when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used as a general greeting during the daytime.
example: こんにちは、お元気ですか？ (konnichiwa, ogenki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used to bid farewell for an extended period.
example: さようなら、また会いましょう！ (sayounara, mata aimashou!) - Goodbye, let's meet again!

when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in formal settings.
example: ありがとうございます、先生！ (arigatou gozaimasu, sensei!) - Thank you, teacher!

when_to_say: Used to affirm or agree.
example: はい、わかりました！ (hai, wakarimashita!) - Yes, I understand!

when_to_say: Used to decline or disagree.
example: いいえ、それは違います。 (iie, sore wa chigaimasu.) - No, that’s incorrect.

when_to_say: Used to politely request something.
example: これをください、お願いします。 (kore o kudasai, onegai shimasu.) - Please give me this.

when_to_say: Used to apologize or get someone's attention.
example: すみません、道を教えてください。 (sumimasen, michi o oshiete kudasai.) - Excuse me, could you tell me the way?

when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the morning formally.
example: おはようございます、みなさん！ (ohayou gozaimasu, minasan!) - Good morning, everyone!

when_to_say: Used as a greeting during the evening.
example: こんばんは、お元気ですか？ (konbanwa, ogenki desu ka?) - Good evening, how are you?

when_to_say: Used to refer to drinking water or natural water sources.
example: 水を一杯ください。 (mizu o ippai kudasai.) - Please give me a glass of water.

when_to_say: Used to talk about consuming food.
example: 私はりんごを食べるのが好きです。 (watashi wa ringo o taberu no ga suki desu.) - I like eating apples.

when_to_say: Used when talking about going somewhere.
example: 学校に行くつもりです。 (gakkou ni iku tsumori desu.) - I plan to go to school.

when_to_say: Used to talk about watching or seeing something.
example: 映画を見るのが好きです。 (eiga o miru no ga suki desu.) - I like watching movies.

when_to_say: Used to refer to cats.
example: この猫はとてもかわいいです。 (kono neko wa totemo kawaii desu.) - This cat is very cute.

when_to_say: Used to refer to dogs.
example: 犬を散歩に連れて行きます。 (inu o sanpo ni tsurete ikimasu.) - I’m taking the dog for a walk.

when_to_say: Used to refer to edible items.
example: 日本の食べ物が好きです。 (nihon no tabemono ga suki desu.) - I like Japanese food.

when_to_say: Used when talking about drinking something.
example: コーヒーを飲むのが好きです。 (koohii o nomu no ga suki desu.) - I like drinking coffee.

when_to_say: Used to describe tasty food.
example: このケーキは美味しいです。 (kono keeki wa oishii desu.) - This cake is delicious.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed or an early time.
example: 彼はとても早いです。 (kare wa totemo hayai desu.) - He is very fast.

when_to_say: Used to talk about educational institutions.
example: 私は学校に行きます。 (watashi wa gakkou ni ikimasu.) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used to address or talk about a teacher.
example: 先生に質問があります。 (sensei ni shitsumon ga arimasu.) - I have a question for the teacher.

when_to_say: Used to express gratitude.
example: ありがとう、助かりました。 (arigatou, tasukarimashita.) - Thank you, that was helpful.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a companion or friend.
example: 私の友達は優しいです。 (watashi no tomodachi wa yasashii desu.) - My friend is kind.

when_to_say: Used to refer to one’s occupation or tasks.
example: 今日は仕事がたくさんあります。 (kyou wa shigoto ga takusan arimasu.) - I have a lot of work today.

when_to_say: Used to discuss or inquire about time.
example: 今、時間は何時ですか？ (ima, jikan wa nanji desu ka?) - What time is it now?

when_to_say: Used to describe a calm or silent environment.
example: この場所はとても静かです。 (kono basho wa totemo shizuka desu.) - This place is very quiet.

when_to_say: Used to refer to academic or self-study activities.
example: 私は日本語を勉強しています。 (watashi wa nihongo o benkyou shiteimasu.) - I am studying Japanese.

when_to_say: Used to describe something new or fresh.
example: 新しい靴を買いました。 (atarashii kutsu o kaimashita.) - I bought new shoes.

when_to_say: Used to describe an enjoyable experience.
example: このパーティーは楽しいです。 (kono paatii wa tanoshii desu.) - This party is fun.

when_to_say: Used to refer to books or written works.
example: 本を読むのが好きです。 (hon o yomu no ga suki desu.) - I like reading books.

when_to_say: Used to refer to streets, pathways, or directions.
example: この道をまっすぐ行ってください。 (kono michi o massugu itte kudasai.) - Please go straight on this road.

when_to_say: Used to address or refer to an instructor.
example: 先生はとても親切です。 (sensei wa totemo shinsetsu desu.) - The teacher is very kind.

when_to_say: Used when talking about the country Japan.
example: 日本は美しい国です。 (nihon wa utsukushii kuni desu.) - Japan is a beautiful country.

when_to_say: Used to describe the red color.
example: 赤い花が好きです。 (akai hana ga suki desu.) - I like red flowers.

when_to_say: Used to refer to vehicles or cars.
example: 車で学校に行きます。 (kuruma de gakkou ni ikimasu.) - I go to school by car.

when_to_say: Used to describe the blue color.
example: 青い空がきれいです。 (aoi sora ga kirei desu.) - The blue sky is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to refer to mountains or hilly terrains.
example: この山はとても高いです。 (kono yama wa totemo takai desu.) - This mountain is very tall.

when_to_say: Used to refer to oceans or seas.
example: 夏に海に行きたいです。 (natsu ni umi ni ikitai desu.) - I want to go to the sea in summer.

when_to_say: Used to refer to shops or establishments.
example: この店は安いです。 (kono mise wa yasui desu.) - This shop is cheap.

when_to_say: Used to describe something aesthetically pleasing.
example: 日本の庭は美しいです。 (nihon no niwa wa utsukushii desu.) - Japanese gardens are beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to discuss or refer to the weather.
example: 今日の天気はどうですか？ (kyou no tenki wa dou desu ka?) - How is the weather today?

when_to_say: Used to describe doing something quickly or at an early time.
example: もっと早く来てください。 (motto hayaku kite kudasai.) - Please come earlier.

when_to_say: Used to describe an enjoyable situation.
example: 旅行はとても楽しいです。 (ryokou wa totemo tanoshii desu.) - The trip is very fun.

when_to_say: Used when talking about purchasing something.
example: 新しい服を買いました。 (atarashii fuku o kaimashita.) - I bought new clothes.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color white.
example: 白い猫がかわいいです。 (shiroi neko ga kawaii desu.) - The white cat is cute.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color black.
example: 黒いシャツを着ています。 (kuroi shatsu o kiteimasu.) - I am wearing a black shirt.

when_to_say: Used to talk about food items.
example: 食べ物は何が好きですか？ (tabemono wa nani ga suki desu ka?) - What food do you like?

when_to_say: Used to refer to drinks or beverages.
example: 飲み物はジュースが好きです。 (nomimono wa juusu ga suki desu.) - I like juice as a drink.

when_to_say: Used to talk about public parks or recreational spaces.
example: 週末に公園で遊びます。 (shuumatsu ni kouen de asobimasu.) - I play in the park on weekends.

when_to_say: Used when referring to airplanes or air travel.
example: 飛行機で東京に行きます。 (hikouki de toukyou ni ikimasu.) - I’m going to Tokyo by airplane.

when_to_say: Used to refer to train or subway stations.
example: 駅はどこですか？ (eki wa doko desu ka?) - Where is the station?

when_to_say: Used to describe snow or snowy weather.
example: 雪が降っています。 (yuki ga futteimasu.) - It is snowing.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the moon or a specific month.
example: 月がきれいです。 (tsuki ga kirei desu.) - The moon is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to describe rainy weather.
example: 今日は雨が降っています。 (kyou wa ame ga futteimasu.) - It is raining today.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the sky or the heavens.
example: 青い空が見えます。 (aoi sora ga miemasu.) - I can see the blue sky.

when_to_say: Used to describe celestial stars.
example: 夜空の星が美しいです。 (yozora no hoshi ga utsukushii desu.) - The stars in the night sky are beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to refer to railway transportation.
example: 電車で通勤します。 (densha de tsuukin shimasu.) - I commute by train.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a room in a house or building.
example: この部屋は広いです。 (kono heya wa hiroi desu.) - This room is spacious.

when_to_say: Used to describe height or cost.
example: このビルは高いです。 (kono biru wa takai desu.) - This building is tall.

when_to_say: Used to describe something low in height or level.
example: この椅子は低いです。 (kono isu wa hikui desu.) - This chair is low.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that weighs a lot.
example: この箱は重いです。 (kono hako wa omoi desu.) - This box is heavy.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is not heavy.
example: このバッグは軽いです。 (kono baggu wa karui desu.) - This bag is light.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed or quickness.
example: 彼の車は速いです。 (kare no kuruma wa hayai desu.) - His car is fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe slowness or lateness.
example: 電車が遅いです。 (densha ga osoi desu.) - The train is slow.

when_to_say: Used to describe warm weather or objects.
example: このスープは温かいです。 (kono suupu wa atatakai desu.) - This soup is warm.

when_to_say: Used to describe cold objects or beverages.
example: 冷たい水をください。 (tsumetai mizu o kudasai.) - Please give me cold water.

when_to_say: Used to describe physical strength or durability.
example: 彼はとても強いです。 (kare wa totemo tsuyoi desu.) - He is very strong.

when_to_say: Used to describe weakness or fragility.
example: この紐は弱いです。 (kono himo wa yowai desu.) - This string is weak.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color blue.
example: 空は青いです。 (sora wa aoi desu.) - The sky is blue.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color red.
example: 赤い花が咲いています。 (akai hana ga saiteimasu.) - A red flower is blooming.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color yellow.
example: 黄色い鳥が飛んでいます。 (kiiroi tori ga tondeimasu.) - A yellow bird is flying.

when_to_say: Used to describe a calm or quiet environment.
example: 図書館は静かです。 (toshokan wa shizuka desu.) - The library is quiet.

when_to_say: Used to describe a busy schedule or situation.
example: 今週はとても忙しいです。 (konshuu wa totemo isogashii desu.) - This week is very busy.

when_to_say: Used to describe something easy or stress-free.
example: この仕事は楽です。 (kono shigoto wa raku desu.) - This job is easy.

when_to_say: Used to describe large or spacious areas.
example: この部屋は広いです。 (kono heya wa hiroi desu.) - This room is spacious.

when_to_say: Used to describe small or confined spaces.
example: この通りは狭いです。 (kono toori wa semai desu.) - This street is narrow.

when_to_say: Used to describe cleanliness or beauty.
example: きれいな花です。 (kirei na hana desu.) - It’s a beautiful flower.

when_to_say: Used to describe something messy or dirty.
example: 部屋が汚いです。 (heya ga kitanai desu.) - The room is dirty.

when_to_say: Used to describe tasty food or drinks.
example: このケーキはおいしいです。 (kono keeki wa oishii desu.) - This cake is delicious.

when_to_say: Used to describe bad-tasting food.
example: このスープはまずいです。 (kono suupu wa mazui desu.) - This soup tastes bad.

when_to_say: Used to describe something sweet in taste.
example: このお菓子は甘いです。 (kono okashi wa amai desu.) - This candy is sweet.

when_to_say: Used to describe spicy food.
example: このカレーは辛いです。 (kono karee wa karai desu.) - This curry is spicy.

when_to_say: Used to describe something sour in taste.
example: このレモンは酸っぱいです。 (kono remon wa suppai desu.) - This lemon is sour.

when_to_say: Used to describe something bitter in taste.
example: この薬は苦いです。 (kono kusuri wa nigai desu.) - This medicine is bitter.

when_to_say: Used to describe something pleasant or enjoyable.
example: 旅行はとても楽しいです。 (ryokou wa totemo tanoshii desu.) - The trip is very enjoyable.

when_to_say: Used to describe feelings of loneliness.
example: 一人だと寂しいです。 (hitori da to sabishii desu.) - It’s lonely to be alone.

when_to_say: Used to describe light or a cheerful personality.
example: 彼は明るい人です。 (kare wa akarui hito desu.) - He is a cheerful person.

when_to_say: Used to describe darkness or a sad mood.
example: この部屋は暗いです。 (kono heya wa kurai desu.) - This room is dark.

when_to_say: Used to describe objects that are old.
example: この本は古いです。 (kono hon wa furui desu.) - This book is old.

when_to_say: Used to describe something new.
example: 新しい車を買いました。 (atarashii kuruma o kaimashita.) - I bought a new car.

when_to_say: Used to describe hot weather.
example: 今日はとても暑いです。 (kyou wa totemo atsui desu.) - It’s very hot today.

when_to_say: Used to describe cold weather.
example: 冬は寒いです。 (fuyu wa samui desu.) - Winter is cold.

when_to_say: Used to describe something close in proximity.
example: 駅は近いです。 (eki wa chikai desu.) - The station is near.

when_to_say: Used to describe something far away.
example: 学校は遠いです。 (gakkou wa tooi desu.) - The school is far.

when_to_say: Used to describe something simple or easy to do.
example: この問題は簡単です。 (kono mondai wa kantan desu.) - This question is easy.

when_to_say: Used to describe something challenging.
example: 日本語は難しいです。 (nihongo wa muzukashii desu.) - Japanese is difficult.

when_to_say: Used to describe slowness or being late.
example: 電車が遅いです。 (densha ga osoi desu.) - The train is slow.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed or quickness.
example: 彼は速く走ります。 (kare wa hayaku hashirimasu.) - He runs fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe a kind person.
example: 彼女は優しいです。 (kanojo wa yasashii desu.) - She is kind.
